stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the stream inside the Wild-West course polishing NPCs: finishing the Dry Bones enemy, importing and wiring animations for a saloon pianist Shy-Guy, and designing a reaction-time shoot-out with a cowboy Boshi Yoshi. He also chats about a secret collaboration level for the retro Course 14 and various tooling/performance topics.

development_findings.summary: Dry Bones enemy finished: line-of-sight chasing, acceleration tuning, animation speed scaled to walk speed, 16-frame crumble animation triggered on jump, footstep sounds added; crumble SFX to be added at end of development
development_findings.quote: I think the Dry Bones is done – looks good to me

development_findings.summary: Boshi NPC will host a duel minigame: dialogue offers Yes/No, randomised countdown, player fires cork gun, Boshi throws an egg; each loss lengthens delay to lower reaction-time difficulty
development_findings.quote: Every time you lose the game gets a little bit easier, just to make sure everyone can beat it

development_findings.summary: Saloon pianist Shy-Guy model cleaned (texture downsizing, UV fixes) and prepared for Zeina to animate as an idle/background character
Secret collab with Aeza: each makes a level that will slot into Course 14 retro area; visuals and gameplay "looking really good" but unrevealed
development_findings.quote: We can just double cash in – we make the popular thing

development_findings.summary: Retro desert keeps MK64 aesthetic despite Kaze finding original "ugly" because it’s framed as a nostalgic bonus stage
development_findings.quote: This is the retro stage… 'Oh look at the retro game Mario Kart 64' – that’s the vibe

development_findings.summary: Engine optimisation: heavy cache use; claims his branch is ~30 % faster than Hexa M64 due to extra micro-optimisations
development_findings.quote: I don’t think there has been a game on the N64 that uses cache as well as this one

development_findings.summary: Technical hurdle: fpdx (rendering microcode) runs slowly; will debug with Sauraen on another day
development_findings.quote: Did you fix new fpdx in your code? – No, it is still too slow on my end… we’ll have to debug it another day

development_findings.summary: Project uses Project64 1.6 despite risks; Parallel Launcher rejected because it fails on Kaze’s PC
development_findings.quote: It doesn’t work on my PC, so what do you want me to do – buy a new PC?

development_findings.summary: Plan to purchase SummerCart flash-cart to replace problematic EverDrive X5; Zeina holds credit card
development_findings.quote: Alright, I’ll get the SummerCart later today then

context_findings.summary: Kaze designs levels as experiments to learn specific skills, valuing experimentation over immediate fun
context_findings.quote: I always make something with the idea I'm going to learn from this and become even better

context_findings.summary: Distinguishes intrinsic vs extrinsic motivation in games; praises GTA for intrinsic play, criticises Pokémon for feeling like a job
context_findings.quote: Playing Pokémon kind of feels like a job… but in Tears of the Kingdom building a machine is pure intrinsic motivation

context_findings.summary: Expresses annoyance at parasocial chat questions and repetitive emulator advice, showing occasional frustration
context_findings.quote: If there’s someone who earnestly has a question… I can’t even be mean, so I just get upset – I want this to be over

context_findings.summary: Personal routine: strength-training push/pull/legs every four days; breakfast of protein shake and cereal
Zeina (spouse) participates live, supplies models, and manages shared finances (credit card)

biobak.summary: Receives secret link to collab level for feedback and marketing joke
biobak.quote: Are you a marketing manager now?

biobak.summary: Knows shortcut for resource unpacking; assists with texture workflow

zeina.summary: Animated Dry Bones skeleton and provided Boshi & pianist models
zeina.quote: Zayna animated this guy here – the Dry Bones

zeina.summary: Holds Kaze’s credit card; engaged in purchase of SummerCart hardware
zeina.quote: You still have my credit card, right, Zeina? I'll need that to buy the thing

zeina.summary: Joins chat to approve in-game result: "Dry Bones look really, really good"

key_stories.title: Finishing the Dry Bones
key_stories.summary: Zeina delivers a new Dry Bones model; Kaze must integrate it. He tweaks chase AI, line-of-sight, animation pacing, and sounds, repeatedly testing until behaviour and visuals feel right.
key_stories.challenge: Create a fresh enemy that feels zombie-like yet fair in gameplay.
key_stories.process: Adjusted acceleration, added footstep sounds, scaled animation speed, implemented 16-frame crumble sequence, ensured visibility cone works.
key_stories.outcome: Declared "done" aside from a late-stage crumble sound; enemy now part of Wild-West course.
key_stories.key_quote: I think the Dry Bones is done – looks good to me.

key_stories.title: Designing the Boshi Shoot-Out
key_stories.summary: Kaze crafts a duel minigame with a cowboy Yoshi (Boshi). He writes edgy cowboy dialogue, scripts a randomised countdown, and plans adaptive difficulty.
key_stories.challenge: Build a reaction-time event that suits the Wild-West theme and accommodates varied player reflexes.
key_stories.process: Imported model, fixed animations, wrote branching dialogue, set camera framing, scripted increasing delay after each failure.
key_stories.outcome: Core behaviour sketched; further coding and animation pending.
key_stories.key_quote: Whoever shoots first wins – and every loss makes it wait slightly longer.

key_stories.title: Secret Retro-Course Collaboration
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Aeza are each building a level for Course 14’s retro segment. Kaze previews his unfinished area privately to Biobak but keeps it hidden from the public.
key_stories.challenge: Coordinate a surprise double-feature without leaking content.
key_stories.process: Develops visuals and gameplay, shares private link for critique, withholds on-stream footage.
key_stories.key_quote: I was working on a level I was not supposed to show yet… it’s looking really good.

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions both are making sub-areas for Course 14 but provides no details.
questions: What is the theme and design philosophy behind your collab levels?
How did the partnership with Aeza arise and how are responsibilities divided?
Any unique mechanics or technical feats planned for this retro area?

open_questions.context: Rules and dialogue drafted, but shooting mechanics, scoring, and audiovisual feedback not shown.
questions: How will the duel handle player input latency on real hardware?
What visual and sound cues indicate success or failure?
Will winning grant a star or unlock content?

open_questions.context: Kaze is undecided about including rideable Yoshi.
questions: What gameplay role would a rideable Yoshi serve in Return to Yoshi's Island?
What technical challenges are involved compared to previous hacks?

open_questions.context: Crumble sound and other SFX postponed until 'end of development'.
questions: What is the team's workflow for creating and integrating new sound effects?
How will memory constraints affect final audio quality?

open_questions.context: Kaze plans to buy a SummerCart to replace EverDrive.
questions: How will the SummerCart influence on-hardware testing and optimisation?
Does the team target specific flash-carts for release compatibility?
